store_books.title: Hamlet
store_books.description: Hamlet is a tragedy by William Shakespeare, believed to have been written between 1599 and 1601. The play, set in Denmark, recounts how Prince Hamlet exacts revenge on his uncle Claudius, who has murdered Hamlet's father, the King.

store_books.title: Macbeth
store_books.description: Macbeth (the Scottish Play) is among the best-known of William Shakespeare's plays, and is his shortest tragedy, believed to have been written between 1603 and 1606.

store_books.title: Pride and Prejudice
store_books.description: The story of Mrs. Bennet's attempts to marry off her five daughters is one of the best-loved and most enduring classics in English literature.

store_books.title: Romeo and Juliet
store_books.description: A tragic play written early in the career of William Shakespeare about two teenage 'star-cross'd lovers' whose untimely deaths ultimately unite their feuding households.

store_books.title: Taming of the Shrew
store_books.description: A nobleman, Petruchio, marries an outspoken, intelligent, and bad-tempered shrew named Katherina. Petruchio manipulates and 'tames' her until she is obedient to his will.
